cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 275 mi SSW of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic, then toward Nova Scotia

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Fundy National Park to Shediac and parts of Newfoundland
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Woods Hole-Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket/Martha’s Vineyard, eastern ME; Hurricane Warning for eastern Nova Scotia
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Offshore Mid-Atlantic waters, southeastern New England coast, Gulf of St. Lawrence, Nova Scotia/Newfoundland
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands may bring brief gusts 30–40 mph Friday evening; sustained tropical-storm winds unlikely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected—previous surge warnings for Mid-Atlantic have been discontinued.
weather_observation.rainfall: Spotty light rain (generally <1 in.) possible as outer bands sweep past Friday night.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High swells and dangerous rip currents in offshore shipping approaches; rough seas for Delaware Bay entrance.
